sentences.en: (=  as a group or in total  ) , women outlive men by 7 or more years.
sentences.cn: 总体来看，女性比男性多活七年或以上。

sentences.en: an increase in the aggregate production
Both sides still stand to gain from trade in the aggregate.
sentences.cn: 总的来说,双方仍能从贸易中获得利益.

sentences.en: But in the aggregate they could launch a fair air strike.
sentences.cn: 但是,如果倾其全部的力量,他们正是可以发动一次相当强劲的空袭的.

sentences.en: England have beaten the Welsh three times in succession with an aggregate score of 83-12.
sentences.cn: 英格兰队已经连续3次打败威尔士队，总比分为83比12。

sentences.en: Expenses are deductible only to the extent that in aggregate they exceed 7 percent of gross income.
sentences.cn: 只有在消费总额超过总收入的7%时才可免税。

sentences.en: Newcastle went out of the competition, losing 2-1 on aggregate.
sentences.cn: 纽卡斯尔队以1比2的总比分被淘汰出局。

sentences.en: Our team scored the most goals on aggregate.
sentences.cn: 整个来说,我们队得分最多.

sentences.en: Sheila’s earnings from all sources aggregated £100,000.
sentences.cn: 希拉的所有收入总计为10万英镑。

sentences.en: The aggregate number of unemployed is fifty thousand this year.
sentences.cn: 今年失业人数总共达五万人.

sentences.en: The football team had a low goal aggregate last season.
sentences.cn: 这支足球队上个赛季的进球总数很少.

sentences.en: The highest aggregate came in the third round where Leeds and Middlesbrough drew 4-4.
sentences.cn: 第三局时出现了最高比分，利兹队和米德尔斯伯勒队打成4比4平。

sentences.en: The money collected will aggregate a thousand dollars.
sentences.cn: 进帐总额将达一千美元.

sentences.en: The rate of growth of GNP will depend upon the rate of growth of aggregate demand.
sentences.cn: 国民生产总值的增长率将取决于总需求的增长率。

sentences.en: The tax increases will, in the aggregate, cause much hardship.
sentences.cn: 增加税收归结起来造成很多困难.

sentences.en: Unit sales for December amounted in the aggregate to 100,000.
sentences.cn: 12月份的单位销售量总数达到十万

sentences.en: Using this approach, we can abstract from fluctuation in Aggregate Demand.
sentences.cn: 运用这一方法, 我们可以抽掉总需求中不断变化的因素.

sentences.en: What is the aggregate of goals from the two football matches?
sentences.cn: 两场橄榄球赛的总进球数是多少?

trans.tran_cn: 总数的，总计的，〈地理〉聚成岩的
trans.tran_en: being the total amount of something after all the figures or points have been added together

trans.tran_cn: 总数，合计，集合，骨料，集料
trans.tran_en: the total after a lot of different figures or points have been added together
to be a particular amount when added together

trans.tran_cn: 总计达， 合计； 使聚集， 使积聚
trans.tran_en: to be a particular amount when added together
